block.p: Leila Marie Kermani, the daughter of Dr. Ebrahim J. Kermani of Saddle River, N.J., and the late Mary P. Mitchell, is to be married today to Eduardo Alberto Santiago-Acevedo, a son of Ana Julia Acevedo and Dr. Antonio Santiago-Vazquez of San Juan, P.R. The Rev. Daniel W. Kreller, an Episcopal priest, is to officiate at the Woodcliff Lake Hilton in Woodcliff Lake, N.J.

Ms. Kermani, 28, is an assistant district attorney in Manhattan, where she works in a trial bureau on misdemeanors. She graduated from New York University and Cornell Law School. Her father, a psychiatrist, practices in Saddle River with Bonnie A. Weiss, the bride's stepmother, who is a family therapist. The bride's mother was a social worker at the Jersey City Medical Center.

Leila Marie Kermani, the daughter of Dr. Ebrahim J. Kermani of Saddle River, N.J., and the late Mary P. Mitchell, is to be married today to Eduardo Alberto Santiago-Acevedo, a son of Ana Julia Acevedo and Dr. Antonio Santiago-Vazquez of San Juan, P.R. The Rev. Daniel W. Kreller, an Episcopal priest, is to officiate at the Woodcliff Lake Hilton in Woodcliff Lake, N.J.

Ms. Kermani, 28, is an assistant district attorney in Manhattan, where she works in a trial bureau on misdemeanors. She graduated from New York University and Cornell Law School. Her father, a psychiatrist, practices in Saddle River with Bonnie A. Weiss, the bride's stepmother, who is a family therapist. The bride's mother was a social worker at the Jersey City Medical Center.

Mr. Santiago-Acevedo, 32, graduated from Purdue, received a law degree from the University of Puerto Rico and is a candidate for a Master of Laws degree in international business and trade at Fordham. His father, a civil engineer, is a partner in CSA Architects and Engineers in San Juan and from 1969 to 1972 was Puerto Rico's secretary of transportation and public works. The bridegroom's previous marriage ended in divorce.
